intro: Octomeria jauaensis, commonly known as the Jauaensis octomeria, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in regions of Brazil and Peru. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, yellow, and orange. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
